chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : nat => is_gcd 1 a b : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%nat_scope
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae_correct_aux : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : positive), In (p, o) l -> In v (ZMicromega.vars 1 p) -> (v <= fold_left ZMicromega.F l 1)%positive
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
ZMicromega.max_var_nformalae_correct : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : positive), In (p, o) l -> In v (ZMicromega.vars 1 p) -> (v <= ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae l)%positive
in_split_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (fst p) (fst (split l))
in_split_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (snd p) (snd (split l))
in_inv : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (l : list A), In b (a :: l) -> a = b \/ In b l
incl_Add_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l u v : list A), ~ In a l -> incl (a :: l) v -> Add a u v -> incl l u
Add_in : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> forall x : A, In x l' < -> In x (a :: l)
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
NoDup_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
NoDup_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
is_set_sind : forall (A : Set) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), is_set A l -> P l -> ~ In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, is_set A l -> P l
is_set_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), is_set A l -> P l -> ~ In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, is_set A l -> P l
inj_neq : forall n m : nat, neq n m -> Zne (Z.of_nat n) (Z.of_nat m)
Inductive NoDup (A : Type) : list A -> Prop := NoDup_nil : NoDup nil | NoDup_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l) Arguments NoDup [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments NoDup_nil _%type_scope Arguments NoDup_cons [A]%type_scope _ [l]%list_scope
ZMicromega.vars = fix vars (jmp : positive) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) {struct p} : list positive := match p with | EnvRing.Pc _ => nil | EnvRing.Pinj j p0 => vars (j + jmp)%positive p0 | EnvRing.PX p0 _ q => jmp :: vars jmp p0 ++ vars (Pos.succ jmp) q end : positive -> EnvRing.Pol Z -> list positive Arguments ZMicromega.vars _%positive_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Add (A : Type) (a : A) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Add_head : forall l : list A, Add a l (a :: l) | Add_cons : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> Add a (x :: l) (x :: l') Arguments Add [A]%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Add_head [A]%type_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Add_cons [A]%type_scope [a] _ [l l']%list_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
factorisation : forall n : nat, {l : list (nat * nat) | is_wf l /\ n = refactor l} + {n = 0}

```coq
intros l p n q m H H0.
induction l as [|x l' IHl'].
- apply cons_is_wf with (p:=p) (n:=n) (tail:=nil); auto.
- destruct (in_wf _ _ _ H0) as [H1 H2].
  apply cons_is_wf with (p:=p) (n:=n) (tail:=l'); auto.
  apply IHl'; auto.
  apply power_power_rel_prime; auto.
Qed.

original: intros l p n q m H H0. induction l as [|x l' IHl']. - apply cons_is_wf with (p:=p) (n:=n) (tail:=nil); auto. - destruct (in_wf _ _ _ H0) as [H1 H2]. apply cons_is_wf with (p:=p) (n:=n) (tail:=l'); auto. apply IHl'; auto. apply power_power_rel_prime; auto.
